page.description: Add a table to a template.

section.description:
The
tags define a table in html. Without defining any cells or styling the table will not be visible. The tags add a new row to a table when they are placed inside the table. Use to add a header cell to a table row.
Use tags to add a regular cell to a table row.
You can add borders to a table and stylize them inside the <table> tag.
Additional attributes like 'bordercolor' can be added to the <table> tag as well.

section.title: Combining a Table with JSON Data
section.description: You can open Alpha Anywhere's 'Template Tester' from the 'Tools' dropdown in the Web Projects Control Panel. Say you have the following 'employees' object defined in the JSON data pane of the Template Tester.
On the the 'Template' pane of the template tester you can access this data by placing the name of the JSON object inside an opening {} and closing {/}.
You can reference a field inside the JSON data by placing the name of the field in {} brackets inside the {employees}{/employees} tags .
This will give you the raw unformatted data. You can use an HTML table inside of the {employees}{/employees} tags to structure the data field, {firstname}, that was added:
section.example:
{employees}
{firstname}
Cell 1
{/employees}
